home.heading:
What
is Geopark
keyfeatures: With a single and unified boundary

With a significant coverage
and scope of geoheritage
threepoints: An area integrated with geology, ecology, natural landscape, local culture and history
A tool to promote earth science and sustainable development through geo-tourism and education
A natural area of special geological significance and natural beauty
fourwhys: Significant rock types scattered across the Geo-Areas, showcasing the complete geological history of Hong Kong
With well established Legal regulations to protect geological sites
Experienced in nature conservation and science popularisation
Consists of rich ecological and cultural heritage enhancing visitors’ travel experience

timeline.content: Designated as a National Geoparks of China, and named Hong Kong National Geopark
Accepted as a member of the Global Geoparks Network, and renamed Hong Kong Global Geopark of China
Renamed Hong Kong UNESCO Global Geopark with the formalisation of the new label “UNESCO Global Geopark

geoarea.name: area
geoarea.content: Consists of two rock regions subdivided into eight geo-areas

geoarea.name: geo-areas
geoarea.content: Consists of two rock regions subdivided into eight geo-areas

geoarea.name: Levels of protection
geoarea.content: Consists of two rock regions subdivided into eight geo-areas

do: Make sure the tour guides have outdoor training and first-aid skills
Camp only in designated sites.
Always tell someone of your detailed plans
Always be alert to changes in surrounding environment and potential hazards such as wet rock surfaces
Plan a route that all members can reasonably handle
Wear suitable hiking outfits and pack usual necessities
Make sure the tour guides have outdoor training and first-aid skills
dont: 1Make sure the tour guides have outdoor training and first-aid skills
Camp only in designated sites.
Always tell someone of your detailed plans
Always be alert to changes in surrounding environment and potential hazards such as wet rock surfaces
Plan a route that all members can reasonably handle
Wear suitable hiking outfits and pack usual necessities
Make sure the tour guides have outdoor training and first-aid skills

content.subtitle: Highlighted feature
content.title: 250Metres in length
content.details: Sand pit was formed when the waves sweep sand and gravel together causing the sediments deposited close to the shore. THe tombolo was formed when two sand pits connected together.

content.subtitle: Highlighted feature
content.title: Connects Sharp Island to Kiu Tau

content.subtitle: Highlighted feature
content.title: Mainly comprises gravel

content.subtitle: Highlighted feature
content.title: Resembles the surface of a pineapple bun due to exfoliation
content.details:
Weathering caused significant temperature differences on the rock surface, which resulted in the minerals on the rock surface expanded or contracted at different degrees.

The outer layer of the rocks peeled off like the layers of an onion.

content.subtitle: Highlighted feature
content.title: Scatters on the beach of the Sharp Island tombolo

content.subtitle: Highlighted feature
content.title: Consists mainly of three minerals, including quartz, feldspar and biotite

content.subtitle: Highlighted feature
content.title: Various igneous rocks including volcanic breccia, eutaxite and rhyoliteare formed
bottomtext: Volcanic breccia: Comprises of different sizes of angular fragments

content.subtitle: Highlighted feature
content.title: Marked the features of volcanic activities in Hong Kong in the Mesozoic Era

content.subtitle: Highlighted feature
content.title: Large-scale of hexagonal rock columns covering area up to 100 km2
